exemplar-jap: 何だか背中がぞくぞくする。風邪かなあ。
exemplar-eng: Something is making my spine TINGLE, maybe I caught a cold.

exemplar-jap: 少し雨が降っている
exemplar-eng: It's raining A LITTLE.

exemplar-jap: このタケノコ、少しえぐいな。のどがいがいがする。
exemplar-eng: This bamboo shoot tastes a bit ACRID. My throat is prickling.

exemplar-jap: なかなか自分の順番がこなくて、いらいらする。
exemplar-eng: My turn in the line still wouldn't come, and I was getting ANNOYED/IMPATIENT.

exemplar-jap: 書いても書いても思うようにならない。
exemplar-eng: No matter how many times I wrote it, I couldn't get it right and I was getting ANNOYED/IMPATIENT.

exemplar-jap: あいつは仕事ののろいやっで。もどかしい。
exemplar-eng: That guy is always so slow at work, it's ANNOYING/makes me IMPATIENT.

exemplar-jap: 体が大きい（大きな人）
exemplar-eng: BIG body (big person)

exemplar-jap: 足を縛る
exemplar-eng: BIND a leg

exemplar-jap: 薬は苦いものだと思っていたけど、このころはそうでもないね。
exemplar-eng: I thought medecine was BITTER, but this time it wasn't so bad.

exemplar-jap: 火を吹く
exemplar-eng: To BLOW on a flame.

exemplar-jap: 少し前はくらかったけど、今は五時前にはもうあかるい。
exemplar-eng: It was a little DARK before, but now it is bright.

exemplar-jap: よく噛んで食べなさい
exemplar-eng: Eat it and CHEW it well!

exemplar-jap: 掃除をしたので、きれいになった。
exemplar-eng: Because I cleaned, it's TIDY now.

exemplar-jap: 今日はなんだか頭がすっきりしない。
exemplar-eng: I just can't CLEAR my head today.
notes: a few places translated this as boNyari, it's listed in sanada_2018 under the pain ideophones for some reason

exemplar-jap: ねちねちと執念深いから、あの人には用心しないといけない。
exemplar-eng: Because they CLING to their grudges, you need to be careful around that person.

exemplar-jap: 網の目が粗い
exemplar-eng: The holes in the mesh are ROUGH.

exemplar-jap: 床が砂でざらざらしている
exemplar-eng: The floor is ROUGH with sand.

exemplar-jap: 今日はかなりさむい。体がぶるぶる震える。
exemplar-eng: Today is really COLD. I'm SHAKING.

exemplar-jap: この水、きんきんにつめたいね。
exemplar-eng: This water is COLD.

exemplar-jap: この水、きんきんにつめたいね。
exemplar-eng: This water is COLD.

exemplar-jap: クーラーをつけて、すずしい部屋で眠る。
exemplar-eng: I turn on the air conditionar and sleep in a COOL room.

exemplar-jap: 庭が狭い
exemplar-eng: The garden is CRAMPED.

exemplar-jap: 心配事が多くて、ストレスで胃がしくしくする。
exemplar-eng: I have so many things to worry about and I have a CRAMPING in my stomach from the stress.

exemplar-jap: 赤ん坊が這う
exemplar-eng: the child CRAWLS

exemplar-jap: 声をあげて泣く
exemplar-eng: raise your voice and CRY

exemplar-jap: ぜんぜんずるい人には見えなかったけどねえ。
exemplar-eng: But they didn't look like a CUNNING person at all.

exemplar-jap: 少し前はくらかったけど、今は五時前にはもうあかるい。
exemplar-eng: It was a little DARK before, but now it is bright.
notes: this is the same root as black which is in the ABVD

exemplar-jap: 洗濯物は乾いたかな。
exemplar-eng: I think the washing is DRY.

exemplar-jap: none given
exemplar-eng: none given

exemplar-jap: 朝からずっと畑仕事していたので、もうぐったりだ。
exemplar-eng: Because I've been working in the field all day, I'm completely exhausted.

exemplar-jap: (暑い中で仕事をした後で)ああ、しんどい
exemplar-eng: (After working in the heat), Aaa, I'm EXHAUSTED.

exemplar-jap: 歩くのが速い
exemplar-eng: Walking FAST

exemplar-jap: 平らな土地
exemplar-eng: FLAT soil.

exemplar-jap: 手ぬぐいが凍る
exemplar-eng: A hand towel FREEZES.
notes: for water freezing, more places just use the basic kooru

exemplar-jap: 水がいっぱいになった
exemplar-eng: The water is FULL (TO THE BRIM)

exemplar-jap: 元気でまた会えて、本当に嬉しいね
exemplar-eng: I'm very GLAD I could see you again and that you're doing well.

exemplar-jap: 日差しがまぶしい。目がちかちかする。
exemplar-eng: The sun's rays are GLARING. My eyes are STINGING.

exemplar-jap: このお弁当は固いなあ
exemplar-eng: This rice is HARD.

exemplar-jap: この荷物はとても重いから、そちらの軽いのを持ってくれ
exemplar-eng: This suitcase is really HEAVY so please take this light one for me.

exemplar-jap: 今日はとんでもなく、暑い。
exemplar-eng: It's incredibly HOT today.

exemplar-jap: 今日はむしあついなあ。むしむししているからエアコンいえて。
exemplar-eng: Today is really HUMID. Because it's so HUMID please turn on the air con.

exemplar-jap: 家の中がじめじめしている。布団もしめっぽい。
exemplar-eng: The inside of the house is HUMID. The futon is also WET.

exemplar-jap: あの頃はひもじい思いをしたものだ。
exemplar-eng: At that time I felt very hungry.

exemplar-jap: 蚊に刺されたあとが痒い。
exemplar-eng: I'm ITCHING after being bitten by a mosquito.

exemplar-jap: セーターが肌にちくちくする。
exemplar-eng: The sweater is ITCHING my skin.

exemplar-jap: この荷物はとても重いから、そちらの軽いのを持ってくれ
exemplar-eng: This suitcase is really heavy so please take this LIGHT one for me.

exemplar-jap: あの人は何歳になっても元気でぴんぴんしている。
exemplar-eng: No matter how old that person gets they are always healthy and LIVELY.

exemplar-jap: 長い紐
exemplar-eng: LONG string.

exemplar-jap: ぬるい風呂に入って風邪をひいた。
exemplar-eng: I took a LUKEWARM bath and got a cold.

exemplar-jap: テレビの音がうるさいよ、もっと小さくして
exemplar-eng: The television is NOISY, turn it down please.

exemplar-jap: 脂っぽい（くどい）おかずばかりで、胸につかえる。
exemplar-eng: Because all the side dishes were so OILY, I have heartburn.

exemplar-jap: （耳の中が腫れて汁が出ているようだ）耳の奥がじくじくする。
exemplar-eng: (When the inside of your ear is swollen and pus is coming out) The back of my ear is OOZING (pus).

exemplar-jap: 頭が割れるように痛い。がんがんする。
exemplar-eng: My head hurts like its been split open. It's POUNDING.

exemplar-jap: ああ、こわかった。まだ胸がどきどきしている。
exemplar-eng: Aa, that was scary. My heart is still POUNDING.

exemplar-jap: このタケノコ、少しえぐいな。のどがいがいがする。
exemplar-eng: This bamboo shoot tastes a bit acrid. My throat is PRICKLING.

exemplar-jap: ここでは何の音もしない。しーんとして静かだね。
exemplar-eng: There's no sound here at all, it's really QUIET.

exemplar-jap: ここでは何の音もしない。しーんとして静かだね。
exemplar-eng: There's no sound here at all, it's really QUIET.

exemplar-jap: 戸をたたく
exemplar-eng: RAP at the door.
notes: it's the basic verb for ‘to hit'

exemplar-jap: 音が大きすぎて、耳がきーんとする。
exemplar-eng: The sound is too loud, my ears are RINGING.

exemplar-jap: 車が回る
exemplar-eng: Wheels ROLL.

exemplar-jap: 円い穴
exemplar-eng: ROUND hole

exemplar-jap: 世の中には図々しい人がいるもんだ。
exemplar-eng: There are some RUDE people in this world.

exemplar-jap: 悲しい話を聞いて泣けてきた。
exemplar-eng: I started crying from hearing the SAD story.

exemplar-jap: 今日の味噌汁、ちょっとうすいね。でも、あまりしょっぱいのはからだに悪いよ。
exemplar-eng: Today's miso soup was a bit weak, but SALTY things aren't good for your body.

exemplar-jap: おじさんが怖い。顔でにらんでいた。
exemplar-eng: Uncle is SCARY. He was glaring.

exemplar-jap: ああ、こわかった。まだ胸がどきどきしている。
exemplar-eng: Aa, that was SCARY. My heart is still pounding.

exemplar-jap: たくさんの犬に追われて、恐ろしい。
exemplar-eng: I was chased by lots of dogs, it was SCARY.

exemplar-jap: つめでかく
exemplar-eng: SCRATCH with your nails.

exemplar-jap: ぼろぼろの物を着て、まったくみすぼらしい。
exemplar-eng: Wearing SHABBY clothes, he's totally shabby.

exemplar-jap: ぼろぼろの物を着て、まったくみすぼらしい。
exemplar-eng: Wearing shabby clothes, he's totally SHABBY.

exemplar-jap: 今日はかなりさむい。体がぶるぶる震える。
exemplar-eng: Today is really COLD. I'm SHAKING.

exemplar-jap: 遅くまで起きていたので、今朝はねむい。
exemplar-eng: Because I was up late, this morning I'm SLEEPY.

exemplar-jap: 温泉に入ったから、肌がすべすべだ。
exemplar-eng: After coming out of the onsen (hot spring), my skin is SLICK.

exemplar-jap: 凍った雪道はつるつるしている。
exemplar-eng: The frozen roads are SLICK.

exemplar-jap: 里芋の皮をむいたので、手がぬるぬるする。
exemplar-eng: My hands are SLIMY from peeling taro.

exemplar-jap: 水を飲みすぎて、おなかがたぷたぷと音がする
exemplar-eng: I drank too much water and now my stomach is making a SLOSHING sound.

exemplar-jap: あいつは仕事ののろいやっで。もどかしい。
exemplar-eng: That guy is always so SLOW at work, it's annoying.

exemplar-jap: 歩くのが遅い
exemplar-eng: Walking SLOW

exemplar-jap: 何だか体がだるい
exemplar-eng: I'm feeling a little SLUGGISH (lit. my body is a little sluggish)

exemplar-jap: 体が小さい
exemplar-eng: A SMALL body.

exemplar-jap: あの人はいつもニコニコしている。
exemplar-eng: That person is always SMILING.

exemplar-jap: 煙が流れてきた。とても煙い。目がしょぼしょぼ。
exemplar-eng: Smoke flowed in, it was really SMOKY. My eyes were watery.
notes: It's actually SMOKE in the ABVD but this is the same root

exemplar-jap: この豆腐はやわらかい
exemplar-eng: This tofu is SOFT.

exemplar-jap: この蜜柑はすっぱいね。
exemplar-eng: This mandarin is really SOUR.

exemplar-jap: この柿、少ししぶいね。
exemplar-eng: This persimmon is a little SOUR.

exemplar-jap: 庭が広い
exemplar-eng: the garden is SPACIOUS

exemplar-jap: このカレー、子供には辛いんじゃない。口がひりひりするよ。
exemplar-eng: Isn't this curry a little SPICY for children? My mouth is tingling.

exemplar-jap: 唾を吐く
exemplar-eng: To SPIT saliva.

exemplar-jap: 納豆はねばっこくてねちゃねちゃしている。
exemplar-eng: Nato is STICKY.

exemplar-jap: テレビを見すぎて目がちかちかする
exemplar-eng: I watched too much TV and now my eyes are STINGING.

exemplar-jap: 日差しがまぶしい。目がちかちかする。
exemplar-eng: The sun is really glary. My eyes are STINGING.

exemplar-jap: 薄いコーヒーよりも濃いコーヒーが好きだ。
exemplar-eng: I prefer STRONG coffee to weak coffee.

exemplar-jap: ごちそうをたくさん食べて満腹になった。満腹でつらい。
exemplar-eng: I ate a lot and now I'm STUFFED. It's painful.

exemplar-jap: 息を吸う
exemplar-eng: SUCK in a breathe.

exemplar-jap: 砂糖を入れすぎて、あまったるい味になってしまった。私は甘いほうが好きだよ。
exemplar-eng: You added too much sugar and now the flavour is sickly sweet. I prefer just a little bit SWEET.

exemplar-jap: 布を裂く
exemplar-eng: TEAR a cloth.

exemplar-jap: この木は太い
exemplar-eng: This tree is THICK.

exemplar-jap: 木の幹が細い
exemplar-eng: The tree trunk is THIN.

exemplar-jap: （傷口が脈打つように痛む）傷がずきずきする。
exemplar-eng: (When a wound is pulsating painfully). It is THROBBING.

exemplar-jap: くすぐるのはやめて。くすぐたいよ。
exemplar-eng: Stop tickling me. It's TICKLING!

exemplar-jap: 太ったせいか、この服はきつい。
exemplar-eng: Because I gained weight, these clothes are tight.

exemplar-jap: このカレー、子供には辛いんじゃない。口がひりひりするよ。
exemplar-eng: Isn't this curry a little spicy for children? My mouth is TINGLING.

exemplar-jap: 日焼けして、背中がひりひりする。
exemplar-eng: I got sunburned and now my back is TINGLING.

exemplar-jap: 今日はぽかぽかと温かい日だ。
exemplar-eng: It's WARM today.

exemplar-jap: 今日はぽかぽかと温かい日だ。
exemplar-eng: It's WARM today.

exemplar-jap: 煙が流れてきた。とても煙い。目がしょぼしょぼ。
exemplar-eng: Smoke flowed in, it was really smoky. My eyes were WATERY.

exemplar-jap: 薄いコーヒーよりも濃いコーヒーが好きだ。
exemplar-eng: I prefer strong coffee to WEAK coffee.

exemplar-jap: 今日の味噌汁、ちょっとうすいね。でも、あまりしょっぱいのはからだに悪いよ。
exemplar-eng: Today's miso soup was a bit WEAK, but salty things aren't good for your body.

exemplar-jap: 服が雨に濡れる。
exemplar-eng: My clothes got WET in the rain.

exemplar-jap: 家の中がじめじめしている。布団もしめっぽい。
exemplar-eng: The inside of the house is MUGGY. The futon is also WET.
